ygData.subject: Re: Welcome Linolas and I need Money!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: Wah kow, really got Ricecooker ah?  LOL. Now I think more than 10 of us at FP, waiting for u guys to join us.  IMHO, CB is not a good xp-vs-toughtness place.
ygData.messageBody:
Wah kow, really got Ricecooker ah? LOL.
Now I think more than 10 of us at FP, waiting for u guys to join us. IMHO,
CB is not a good xp-vs-toughtness place. Try the bandit camp at G Faydark
once u reach lvl 8 with a friend and I think u will lvl faster and get more
loot. Since u are lvl 10, u shld be able to handle the bandit camp solo,
or better still, come to FP join Einan, Ser and guys for group hunting.
Also, be selective in buying scrolls, I only buy those guided DD spells,
and certain utility spells. Dun bother to spend on AE spell, coz these
spells sux in damaging and it will draw all mobs on u, making u die faster.
FYI I dun use unguided spells too, regret buying them. I got 3 spell
slots for diff lvl of DD spells, followed by 2 shieding spells, invis, root
and gate. No place for unguided DD spells. ;(
Btw, what's an EX-S'porean ah?
Lvl 8 scrolls is 5-6 pp each meh? I thot lvl 12 then is ard 5-6pp. Forget
abt lvl 16 but the lvl 20 is ard 10pp each.
Casters dun have many selection in armor, I'm still wearing mainly clothes
now.
As for brewing, I think 5-8pp will do, coz u can brew and sell back to npc.
Thou not profitable but still can help to get back some money to continue
training. I start brewing with zero skill. Just train and it shld rise to
1, no need to spend skill point on it.
Also dun waste ya time on getting fine steel or great staff. Save 20-25pp
for Runed Totem Staff, it the best staff we can afford from lvl 10-20.
Getting a fine steel or great staff will not allow u to hurt magical mobs
like wisp, and the price is just few pp cheaper. Better save for RTS
rather than to regret later.
I've cutt rings with me, saving for own kakis. Come to FP and I pass u
FOC, +1ac and +2dex, not very cool but help in casting.



On Monday, 05 July, 1999 10:06 AM, Synzzz [SMTP:hannibal@...]
wrote:
> From: "Synzzz" <hannibal@...>
>
> Yo Linolas,
>
> I think you've been hanging around the orc camp outside CrushBone right?
> Thought I saw you yesterday. Say Hi if you see me! I know most of them
are
> on Freeport that side [the one with big Parang and the rest =) ]
> But there might be more of us around Faydwer...so let's keep a lookout.
> Oh and Ricecooker is a gal! *news update* And She's ex-Singaporean
> Hahahahaha
>
> Should I start that brewing thing now? I'm always broke...just spent 20+
> plats yesterday
> buying my lvl 8 spells....*SOB* Still got more to buy! And only 2 more
lvls
> to lvl 12,
> each spell will cost 6-8 plats??? Forgot but i know i won't be able to
> afford much again!
> So pls give me some advice...should i do the brewing thing? Honestly it
> doesn't
> seem like something i would like to do...but if i have to pay for my
> spells...no choice!
>
> Up till now i never bought any stuff besides spells! My armor (cloth) all
> taken from
> slain orcs/pixies! My Worn Great Staff also picked up from dead orc!
ARGHH!!
> Can't afford a Fine Steel Great Staff or anything good! Although i had a
> nice necro
> group up with me then gave me 2 rings of Agility hmm...worth much??
>
> I came by the port Seraph mentioned in Butcherblock and then saw a boat
> leave...sat there
> for 10 mins thinking of whether i should go...And then i heard about
giant
> chessboard
> and i ran off to it forgetting about trip to FP *LOL*
>
> p.s According to Neriak.com brewing takes about 10pp to start...is that
> right?
> And how many pts should i dump into training it?
>
> Yours Magically,
>
> Zanderion 10th lvl Magician
>
>
>
>
>
